II. Purpose of Addendum
The facility has requested to change the terms of their license to their approved
capacity of 32 to be all used for co-ed secure short-term programing. The facility is
currently approved for 24 beds to be co-ed secure short-term program and 8 beds
to be male secure treatment program. The facility is requesting to close the terms
of the 8 beds secure treatment program and use that capacity for the short-term
programing.
III. Methodology
10/06/2022- Email from Chief Administrator asking how to be able to use the 8
treatment beds (pod A) for the short-term programing beds.
10/06/2022- Application Received- Request to change the terms of the 8 secure
treatment beds (pod A) to be in included within the 24 secure short-term programing
beds.
10/06/2022- Contact- Phone call- Consultant spoke with the Chief Administrator on
the phone about application request.
IV. Description of Findings and Conclusions
The Muskegon Juvenile Detention Center has been approved to have a capacity of
32 youth across four different pods; Pod A1, Pod A2, Pod B1, and Pod B2. Pod A1
was approved to have a capacity of 8 males for a secure treatment programing.
Pod A2, Pod B1, and Pod B2 had the capacity of 24 co-ed youth for a secure short-
term programing. During the COVID-19 pandemic, the Muskegon Juvenile
Detention Center began to see lower number in census especially within Pod A1. In
March of 2021, the facility’s counselor for Pod A1 departed and the facility
discharged the last two youth in Pod A1. Since that time the facility has no
placement within Pod A1 and the rooms are not being used. Recently, the facility
has been maintaining a census of low 20’s within their secure short-term
programing and have been getting more request to place youth within that program.
To accommodate those needs, the facility wants to cease their treatment program
on Pod A1 and utilize it for secure coed short-term program. The layout of Pod A1
is not different then the secure short-term pods and would be able to meet that
populations need. Pod A1 would be able to accommodate co-ed youth.
2

V. Recommendation
I recommend for the terms of the Muskegon Juvenile Detention Center remain at
an approved capacity of 32. I recommend for the terms of the license have all 32
beds be co-ed secure short-term programing.
